Ingredients: 

• 25 canned or pre-cooked escargot (usually sold in a can or jar) 
• 5 cloves of garlic, finely minced 
• 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, finely chopped 
• 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature 
• Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste 
• 5 small escargot serving dishes (typically with small wells to hold the escargot) 
• 1 French baguette or crusty bread for serving 

Procedure: 

1. Preheat the Oven: 

Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) to warm up the escargot. 

2. Prepare the Escargot: 

* Drain the canned or pre-cooked escargot. 
* Rinse them under cold water to remove any excess canning liquid. 

3. Make the Garlic Butter: 

* In a mixing bowl, combine the softened unsalted butter, minced garlic, and chopped fresh parsley. Season the mixture with a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. 
* Mix all the ingredients thoroughly to create a flavorful garlic herb butter. 

4. Assemble the Escargot: 

* Place an escargot into each well of the escargot serving dishes. 
* Spoon a generous amount of the garlic herb butter mixture over each escargot. 

5. Bake the Escargot: 
* Place the filled escargot dishes in the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes or until the butter is bubbling, and the escargot are heated through. 

6. Serve the Escargot: 

* Remove the escargot dishes from the oven. 
* Carefully serve each dish while still hot. Typically, escargot is served with a special escargot fork and tongs to hold the shells steady while you use the fork to extract the escargot. 
* Provide small forks, toothpicks, or small pieces of bread for scooping out the escargot and sopping up the delicious garlic herb butter. 
* Serve with slices of French baguette or crusty bread to soak up the flavorful butter. 


Enjoy your homemade escargot as a delicious and indulgent appetizer!
